intro: Gilia pallida, commonly known as the pale gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert and semi-desert environments. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pale pink to white in color, with five petals. Gilia pallida is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
